svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - January 18 2019
title: "January 18, 2019" date: "2019-01-18"
Ethereum News and Links
Constantinople postponed
• The day before the scheduled Constantinople upgrade fork, ChainSecurity found that EIP1283
potentially allowed deployed contracts to be vulnerable to a re-entrancy attack . There was no bug in
the EIP per se, but it broke an implied invariant for a small but then-indeterminate amount of
deployed code. Hence, out of an abundance of caution but with limited time for the community to come
to consensus, Constantinople was successfully postponed .
The day before the scheduled Constantinople upgrade fork, ChainSecurity found that EIP1283 potentially
allowed deployed contracts to be vulnerable to a re-entrancy attack . There was no bug in the EIP per
se, but it broke an implied invariant for a small but then-indeterminate amount of deployed code.
Hence, out of an abundance of caution but with limited time for the community to come to consensus,
Constantinople was successfully postponed .
• A full post-action report by Trail of Bits, ChainSecurity, and Eveem. They proffer a different
alternative to 1283 - refund difference of intended cost of writes. Magicians thread on 1283
alternatives and thread on invariants .
A full post-action report by Trail of Bits, ChainSecurity, and Eveem. They proffer a different
• New ConstantiNOPE client releases by which the fork was avoided (update if you haven’t): Geth ,
Parity (stable) and beta , Trinity , Nethermind , Pantheon , Ethereum on ARM
New ConstantiNOPE client releases by which the fork was avoided (update if you haven’t): Geth , Parity
(stable) and beta , Trinity , Nethermind , Pantheon , Ethereum on ARM
• Constantinople is set for block 7280000 , around Feb 27. EIP1283 is not included.
Constantinople is set for block 7280000 , around Feb 27. EIP1283 is not included.

If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys .
I own Week In Ethereum. Editorial control has always been 100% me.
If you’re unhappy with editorial decisions or anything that I have written in this issue, feel free to
tweet at me .
Housekeeping
Follow me on Twitter, because most of what is linked here gets tweeted first: @evan_van_ness
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum ?”
